Merel C.J. Scholman

Language Science and Technology · Saarland University · m.c.j.scholman [at] coli.uni-saarland.de

I'm a postdoctoral researcher in Prof. Vera Demberg's lab.

I'm interested in cognitive models of language understanding, focusing on coherence in particular. I use a combination of offline and online methodologies - corpus-based studies, crowdsourced studies, and reading time experiments - to investigate questions related to the interpretation and processing of discourse.

My current projects focus on individual differences in the processing and comprehension of discourse-level phenomena (ERC-funded project IDDISC), and information-theoretic explanations for discourse production and comprehension (SFB-funded project 1102).
